acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in a shipment of court papers from Buchanan County.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Buchanan County was named for the United States president James Buchanan and was formed from Tazewell and Russell Counties in 1858.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Buchanan County (Va.) Justice of the Peace Records, 1877-1927 , consist of Records of Judgments, Volume 8; Justices' Civil Judgments and Executions, Volume 2; and paper copies of Justices' Civil Judgments and Executions; paper copies of Executions returned by Constables on Judgments of the Justices of the Peace; paper copies of Justices' Criminal Judgments; and paper copies of Criminal Judgments Lien Docket for Justices of the Peace. After 1869, the Justices of the Peace heard civil or criminal cases for which existing statutes applied. They also conducted coroners' or lunacy inquestions and performed civil marriages.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Buchanan County Court Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm"
